title: Make in India "miracle"
selftext:
​

[Manufacturing, value added \(% of GDP\) - India](https://preview.redd.it/mj5k3tcwq06c1.png?width=882&format=png&auto=webp&s=361ea8e8ec4dbf37162543a0a684bb7c394f5291)

[https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NV.IND.MANF.ZS?locations=IN](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NV.IND.MANF.ZS?locations=IN)

The data is from the world bank. Despite all the hooha and Vishwaguru's promise of Make in India, this is the reality which the government hides and any criticism is considered as anti-national by them. It should be accepted by now that manufacturing won't take place in India and there is time bomb waiting to explode in the Indian economic miracle.
comments:
Y-axis is  % Manufaturing in GDP - Not absolute value of Manufacturing output.

It just means, Services and Agri sectors grew faster than Manufacturing.

​

Here is the better graph:

[https://www.macrotrends.net/countries/IND/india/manufacturing-output](https://www.macrotrends.net/countries/IND/india/manufacturing-output)

But, Yes - India needs more manufacturing.
